channel.title: Yo
channel.description:
hey guys, i've searched all over google but i havent been able to find anything related to this subject.
do you know how when you're in your bank and you want withdraw cash and do 10m instead of 10000000, well could someone please post a tut of this? thanks

item.title: Yo
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:12, topic:523815”] if (input.contains("m")) toGive = 10000000; [/quote]

i understand that, but what im saying is i get errors, and i need to fix them so i can do 10m insread of 10000000

how come it cant find symbol j?

Read full topic

item.title: Yo
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

[quote=“Host Gushers, post:9, topic:523815”]} else if (inputDialogState == 1) {

Your client.java doesn’t even have that…you probably deleted it to show me that its your regular client.java. what base is this ? ill look @ it myself.[/quote]

yes it does line 199

} else if(inputDialogState == 1) { chatTextDrawingArea.drawText(0, "Enter amount:", 60, 259); chatTextDrawingArea.drawText(128, amountOrNameInput + "*", 80, 259);

i understand that he said his base is heavily refactored, but how would i know what to change the code too to give no errors?

Read full topic

item.title: Yo
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

u loose, in Galkon’s tutorial he explains that his base is heavily refactored and so you will need to manually change the variable names in the code to match yours.

Read full topic

item.title: Yo
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Hey u loose. In future, please use a more descriptive title to ensure you get help quicker (a good title for this thread would be “Letters in Enter Amount interface”).

Anyway, I don’t think that this is handled server-sided. As the Enter Amount interface is handled in a separate packet, I think it’s a client feature.

Read full topic
